title: How Did They Do It? Questions Swirl Over Two Escaped Convicts
teaser: Investigators in upstate New York are trying to figure out how two murderers were able to saw, cut and drill their way out of prison.
contentencoded:
As a massive manhunt continues, investigators in upstate New York are still trying to figure out how two violent murderers were able to saw, cut and drill their way out of a maximum security prison.

Governor Andrew Cuomo says the two men almost certainly had outside help in getting power tools and figuring out their escape pathway, and investigators are now going over records of civilian employees and private contractors, looking for anyone who might have had reason to help the convicts.

Brian Mann of North Country Public Radio joins Here & Now’s Robin Young with the latest.

Guest

  • Brian Mann, Adirondack bureau chief for North Country Public Radio. He tweets @BrianMannADK.
